newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian lending rate down to 11.1 pct from 11.4.
newsitem.headline: Croatian lending rate down to 11.1 pct from 11.4.

text.p: Croatia's average money market rate eased to 11.1 percent on Tuesday from Friday's 11.4 precent despite strong demand for kuna.
Daily trade totalled 71.6 million kuna, against demand for 75 million, dealers said.
Call money, accounting for almost 50 million kuna in fresh borrowings, rose to 11 percent from 10.5 percent last week.
Insurers rolled over one-week loans at an unchanged 9.0 percent. Banks charged between 12 and 15 percent for renewed term deals, also steady at recent levels.
The central bank calculated its kuna midrates for Wednesday firmer at 5.9473 to the dollar and 3.5647 against the German mark. -- Sandra Kalogjera, Zagreb Newsroom 385-1-4557075
